title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 06 February 2012 - XWiki
content:
10:22 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
10:23 <issue> has joined #xwiki  
10:25 <issue> Good morning guys, I've got a problem with the mail configuration, I'm getting this error sending invitations "javax.mail.MessagingException: Could not connect to SMTP host: xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx, port: 389 at com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPTransport.openServer(SMTPTransport.java:1282) ~[mail-1.4.jar:1.4]   could you help?  
10:35 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
11:11 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
11:12 <+tmortagne> issue: does you wiki has access to this host and port ?  
11:15 <issue> has quit  
11:33 <CIA-120> tmortagne master \* rb3e6492 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/b3e64920ae229d569d1e1ca2eb61000f93fa7692 / xwiki-rendering-test/src/main/java/org/xwiki/rendering/test/integration/RenderingTest.java : Better configuration management - http://git.io/Bsl4QQ  
11:53 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
11:57 <kwoot> has joined #xwiki  
12:02 <recompile> has quit  
12:06 <kwoot> Hi. I just updated to 3.4. I changed the PermGenSpace to 1g. It starts, but everytime I let apache manager do a reload because I changed a conf setting the Java hangs and I am out of PermGenSpace. During startup I get a LOT of complaints like "SEVERE: The web application [/xwiki] appears to have started a thread named [EvictionTimer-0] but has failed to stop it. This is very likely to create a memory leak.". What is happening here? HELP!  
12:13 <CIA-120> tmortagne master \* r8048e2d https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/8048e2d7464f9c82d356e043aaa5c4e7f618bf8a / (4 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7492: Separate local extensions by folders - http://git.io/6jVkmw  
12:15 <+tmortagne> kwoot: 1g seems really a lot, we usually use a lot less than that AFAIK  
12:15 <+tmortagne> but I doubt it has anything to do with the EvictionTimer  
12:23 <+tmortagne> now I usually fully restart tomcat when I modify something I don't think I ever just reloaded  
12:24 <+tmortagne> can't you simply restart it ?  
12:24 <+tmortagne> maybe there is some stuff not properly cleaned when just doing a reload which produce a memory leak somewhere  
12:31 <Andrei> has joined #xwiki  
12:31 <Andrei> has left #xwiki  
12:31 <AndreiHalici> has joined #xwiki  
13:04 <kayasaman> tmortagne:just glossing over this I also experienced the 'memory' leak and eventually I setthe PermGenSpace to 3.5G  
13:05 <kayasaman> tmortagne: with Apache Tomcat one will get that it seems....  
13:06 <kayasaman> although am running FreeBSD my settings are as follows: tomcat60\_java\_opts="-Djava.awt.headless=true -Dfile.encoding=UTF-8 -server -Xms3072m -Xmx3072m -XX:NewSize=256m -XX:MaxNewSize=256m -XX:PermSize=256m -XX:MaxPermSize=256m -XX:+DisableExplicitGC"  
13:09 <+tmortagne> kayasaman: xwiki.org has -XX:MaxPermSize=150m  
13:09 <+tmortagne> (I actually tough is was more)  
13:09 <+tmortagne> I usually use 256 too  
13:10 <kayasaman> tmortagne: possibly but for whatever reason Tomcat on BSD at least creates a massive memory leak  
13:10 <+tmortagne> on permgen ?  
13:10 <+tmortagne> when you do reload ?  
13:10 <kayasaman> out of 2.5G swap and 4G main memory 'all' of it was used  
13:10 <+tmortagne> or just by running a long time ?  
13:10 <kayasaman> after reload its fine then fills up after like a day or two  
13:11 <+tmortagne> (by reload I don't mean restart but the thing for reloading the app without restarting tomcat)  
13:11 <kayasaman> erm I'm talking about restarting the Tomcat service  
13:11 <+tmortagne> ok then it's weird, maybe you have a too big document cache  
13:11 <kayasaman> as in /etc/init.d/tomcat6 restart (linux convention)  
13:12 <kayasaman> not sure but my wiki was being weird for a while  
13:12 <kayasaman> once i get the skinning sorted out things will be fine  
13:12 <+tmortagne> what takes most of the memory is usually the document cache so it has to be carefully configured  
13:12 <kayasaman> but had to use the Xwiki flie system to achieve my goals  
13:12 <kayasaman> hmm.... which is Tomcat?  
13:13 <kayasaman> or backend DB?  
13:13 <kayasaman> or Xwiki  
13:13 <+tmortagne> I mean the cache in XWiki which contains documents  
13:13 <kayasaman> oh ok... mine is stock  
13:13 <kayasaman> i didn't edit that at all  
13:13 <+tmortagne> the one you viewed ecently  
13:13 <+tmortagne> hmm  
13:13 <+tmortagne> I think it's pretty small by default, checking  
13:14 <kayasaman> but then again I upgraded from 2.x to 3.1.1 which caused most issues  
13:14 <kayasaman> but then rectified them  
13:14 <kayasaman> after things were complete  
13:15 <+tmortagne> default cache size is 100 elements which not not that much  
13:15 <kayasaman> hmm.... my services seem to have filled swap again:  
13:15 <kayasaman> Mem: 723M Active, 230M Inact, 2716M Wired, 109M Cache, 408M Buf, 51M Free  
13:15 <kayasaman> Swap: 2327M Total, 695M Used, 1631M Free, 29% Inuse  
13:15 <kayasaman>   PID JID USERNAME   THR PRI NICE   SIZE    RES STATE   C   TIME   WCPU COMMAND  
13:15 <kayasaman> 84674   4 www         66  48    0  3572M   352M ucond   2  42:10  0.00% java  
13:15 <kayasaman> 85826   3 www         71  44    0  3570M   380M ucond   3  46:42  0.00% java  
13:15 <+tmortagne> 4G is really big  
13:15 <kayasaman> yeah for whatever reason my wiki just goes nuts  
13:16 <kayasaman> thats why i want to test it 'longterm' with Glassfish as it seems more stable  
13:16 <kayasaman> i got away with 2G virtual machine and Solaris which takes a lot RAM in its own right  
13:16 <+tmortagne> you get a pick of memory consumption or it it looks like a memory leak growing slowly ?  
13:17 <kayasaman> i think memory leak growing slowly  
13:17 <kayasaman> i mean tomcat actually segfaulted multiple times saying "out of memory" in the logs  
13:18 <kayasaman> i don't know what relationship images and multimedia content have  
13:18 <kayasaman> but i do have quite a few photos within the "photo album" plugin  
13:18 <+tmortagne> yea but could be a huge attachment filling the memory or something like that which is really not the same thing as something leaking memory  
13:18 <+tmortagne> thing is I don't remember any known memory leak in 3.1.1  
13:19 <kayasaman> with 3.1.1 is much more stable  
13:19 <kayasaman> i mean my Xwiki has been up for weeks now without any issues  
13:19 <kayasaman> or my Java process restart script :-)  
13:19 <+tmortagne> ho ok I tough you had  the issue with 3.1.1  
13:20 <kayasaman> currently thre is a bit of swap being shown which i posted the top output above  
13:20 <kayasaman> but that's probably normal  
13:20 <kayasaman> i mean the server in general is pretty loaded with 2x tomcat instances 2x postgres instances  
13:20 <+tmortagne> yea it's java reserving what you told it too reserve  
13:20 <+tmortagne> I think  
13:20 <+tmortagne> you could reduce a bit the allocated memory  
13:21 <+tmortagne> -Xmx3072m is pretty big  
13:26 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
13:45 <Denis> has left #xwiki  
13:45 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
13:58 <recompile> has joined #xwiki  
14:31 <kayasaman> the xiwkibot seems to be working again! :-)  
14:32 <+tmortagne> yea, restarted xwiki.org  
14:32 <+tmortagne> looks like at some point something is breaking it  
14:32 <+tmortagne> which is not fixed by restarting just the bot itself  
14:34 <+tmortagne> committers: anyone whiling to be the build manager this week ?  
14:47 <kayasaman> tmortagne: do you by anychance know when the Xwiki skins document is gong to be fixed?  
14:47 <kayasaman> it shows Vincent as the creater of it but there's nothing there  
14:48 <+tmortagne> kayasaman: sorry did not followed the issue, what's wrong ?  
14:48 <kayasaman> here: this doc: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Skins  
14:48 <kayasaman> there's nothing on the page ie. broken  
14:49 <kayasaman> i need to know the syntax for editing the skin within Xwiki itself  
14:49 <+tmortagne> hmm looks like it's displayed as if it was a skin document  
14:49 <+tmortagne> but it's not  
14:49 <kayasaman> yeah...  
14:49 <+tmortagne> but it as a skin object  
14:49 <+tmortagne> which cause the sheet system to think it's supposed to display it that way  
14:50 <+tmortagne> looking  
14:50 <kayasaman> i've customized my wiki's skins but edited teh file-system and was told that was the 'wrong' way  
14:50 <kayasaman> so need to try to use the Admin panel instead but syntax can't be found anywhere??  
14:51 <+tmortagne> well the problem with editing the fs is that it bacame a nighmare to upgrade that's all then it's your choice  
14:51 <kayasaman> aha but if I edit directly within Xwiki Admin Panel i can upgrade easily with less hastle  
14:51 <kayasaman> have already experienced issues  
14:52 <kayasaman> wiht upgrade doing the filesystem route  
14:52 <kayasaman> so need to figure out syntax to insert into Admin  
14:52 <kayasaman> i tried dumping the CSS in but it broke my UI  
14:53 <+tmortagne> here fixed  
14:53 <+tmortagne> I think  
14:53 <kayasaman> yeay! :-)  
14:55 <kayasaman> so i'm guessing from there i create a doc.css file, upload to server  
14:55 <kayasaman> then add in as additional style sheet?  
14:56 <kayasaman> hope it will work....  
14:56 <kayasaman> i'll try quickly  
14:56 <+tmortagne> don't know much about how to customize skins sorry  
14:56 <kayasaman> don't worry  
14:56 <+tmortagne> I'm more a a server side guy ;)  
14:56 <kayasaman> i'll try then document as always  
14:56 <+tmortagne> ok cool  
14:57 <kayasaman> actually you may be able to tell me... i have 3 howto guides on the Xwiki devs site  
14:57 <kayasaman> who do i talk to about getting them integrated into the xwiki.org site??  
14:57 <+tmortagne> you ? :)  
14:58 <kayasaman> eh?  
14:58 <+tmortagne> if you fill they are complete you should move them unless you don't know were if that case I can maybe help you  
14:58 <kayasaman> oh ok  
14:58 <kayasaman> well here are the URLs:  
14:58 <kayasaman> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/BSD\_Migration?viewer=code  
14:58 <+tmortagne> you can also ask for a review on the mailing list if you are not sure  
14:58 <kayasaman> sorry without hte vieercode part  
14:58 <kayasaman> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/BSD\_Instalhttp://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/BSD\_Instal  
14:59 <kayasaman> and last but not least:  
14:59 <kayasaman> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/Glassfish\_Solaris  
14:59 <kayasaman> yeah maybe i'll do that!  
14:59 <+tmortagne> you sure the custom style for text is needed ?  
14:59 <AndreiHalici\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:59 <kayasaman> ?? am just using unicode i think  
15:00 <kayasaman> could take it out if doesn't fit  
15:00 <AndreiHalici> has quit  
15:00 <+tmortagne> I see the whole content is in a div with  
15:00 <+tmortagne> (% class="moz-text-plain" graphical-quote="true" lang="x-unicode" style="font-family: -moz-fixed; font-size: 13px;" wrap="true" %)  
15:00 <+tmortagne> wondering why you don't just use default style  
15:01 <kayasaman> i created a bunch of page templates ages ago  
15:01 <kayasaman> then just picked one and used it...  
15:02 <+tmortagne> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/Glassfish\_Solaris sounds like something for http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation#HTutorials  
15:02 <+tmortagne> hmm  
15:02 <kayasaman> they all are kinda like that  
15:02 <kayasaman> as freebsd guide the same  
15:02 <kayasaman> migration is slightly more advanced but is similar in nature too  
15:04 <kayasaman> well let me ping the mail list about them and see what people think  
15:05 <+tmortagne> I think both should be somehwre in http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/ space  
15:05 <+tmortagne> I would say http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationGlassfishSolaris for http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/Glassfish\_Solaris plus a link in http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation#HTutorials  
15:06 <kayasaman> ok  
15:06 <kayasaman> am just pining the mail list to see what the other guys feel about it additionally too  
15:06 <tmortagne> has left #xwiki  
15:07 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
15:07 <+tmortagne> sure  
15:07 <+tmortagne> did not took much look at the detailed content yet  
15:07 <+tmortagne> was more thinking where this kind of thing should go  
15:07 <kayasaman> yeah and i agree with your judgement :-)  
15:08 <+tmortagne> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/BSD\_Install -> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationBSD with a link in http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation#HTutorials  
15:08 <+tmortagne> not sure about http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/BSD\_Migration  
15:08 <+tmortagne> sounds like the first guide about migrating from one system to another (is that it ?)  
15:09 <kayasaman> yep  
15:09 <kayasaman> basically for changing servers  
15:09 <kayasaman> or from one OS to another  
15:09 <+tmortagne> could be a new section in http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/ I guess  
15:09 <kayasaman> or even Java container  
15:09 <+tmortagne> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Migration  
15:09 <kayasaman> yeah something like that  
15:10 <+tmortagne> and either you put your guide as it is or you put some general stuff in it and then a link to your BSD/postgre oriented tutorial  
15:11 <kayasaman> ok  
15:12 <kayasaman> i mean i host my own howto based wiki anyway so if the stuff isn't going to fit-in with the xwiki.org site  
15:12 <kayasaman> links can be put to my own site...?? baring in mind i don't have much bandwidth  
15:12 <kayasaman> as only on dsl connection  
15:13 <kayasaman> but would be more accessable to be on xwiki.org IMHO  
15:13 <+tmortagne> as you prefer but it's probably better for everyone if it's on xwiki.org, someone could improve what you did  
15:14 <kayasaman> my thoughts exactly  
15:16 <kayasaman> thanks btw for checking the stuff out :-)  
15:16 <+tmortagne> no problem sorry it took so long for the skin page to be fixed especially since you asked several times  
15:17 <kayasaman> its ok! i was actually referring more to my own docs but on both counts i really appreciate it!!!  
15:18 <kayasaman> you know i think more and more companies round the UK are starting to hear about Xwiki  
15:18 <kayasaman> i can't stop talking about it in job interviews...  
15:18 <+tmortagne> that's cool :)  
15:18 <kayasaman> its soo funny  
15:18 <kayasaman> but Xwiki is really great so it makes sense :-D  
15:18 <+tmortagne> of course ;)  
15:19 <kayasaman> hey am just happy to be here and part of it!  
15:20 <+tmortagne> the more people the more fun :D  
15:20 <kayasaman> true and if they're a cool bunch like everyone who's been developing Xwiki for the past however long the project's been in existance for  
15:21 <kayasaman> the Xwiki team is: helpful, friendly, nowledgeable and just great to be in contact and part of  
15:22 <kayasaman> all in all=success :-)  
15:22 <+tmortagne> always nice to hear :)  
15:23 <kayasaman> please pass it on to everyone!  
15:23 <kayasaman> as they should know about it.  
15:25 <+tmortagne> done ;)  
15:25 <kayasaman> :-)  
15:26 <AndreiHalici\_> is now known as <AndreiHalici>  
15:28 <+tmortagne> cjd: I'm sure you would love to be build manager O:-)  
15:28 <+tmortagne> Denis maybe ?  
15:32 <+tmortagne> kayasaman: better asking this kind of question on the mailing list  
15:32 <+tmortagne> not much people look at comments  
15:32 <+tmortagne> or only when getting notif from IRC bot ;)  
15:32 <kayasaman> hmm... i did but no one was really able to help  
15:32 <kayasaman> :-(  
15:33 <kayasaman> i could try again though  
15:33 <+tmortagne> ok did not know, I don't think you would get more help on comments in any case  
15:33 <kayasaman> yeah... well it was worth a shot  
15:33 <+tmortagne> sure  
15:33 <kayasaman> unless i could directly contact any skin developer  
15:34 <kayasaman> even though everyone's really busy  
15:34 <kayasaman> don't wana disturb anyone  
15:34 <kayasaman> i'll try the mailing list again perhaps  
15:34 <+tmortagne> usually mailing list is best for it but if you did not get any answer... yes you can retry and see  
15:35 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
15:42 <kayasaman> tmortagne: there posted on xwiki mailing list  
15:42 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:43 <kayasaman> hopefully someone will get back now////  
15:47 <lucaa> has quit  
16:05 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
16:10 <help> has joined #xwiki  
16:11 <help> is now known as <Guest10272>  
16:11 <CIA-120> Marius Dumitru Florea feature-alfresco-link \* ra2cc52b https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/a2cc52befc0acc395054761d547dc30d3499d121 / (2142 files in 494 dirs): Merge branch 'master', remote-tracking branch 'origin' into alfresco-master (+59 more commits...) - http://git.io/lgQzHg  
16:18 <Guest10272> Hi guys, is there a way to avoid to show admin activities in the activity stream?  
16:19 <vmassol> Guest10272: users will only see pages they're allowed to see in the AS.  
16:19 <vmassol> you can also list the spaces for which you wish to see activity for (see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Activity+Macro)  
16:20 <vmassol> we can list authors too but would be nice to be able to say "all authors except this one"  
16:21 <Guest10272> yep, exactly  
16:21 <Guest10272> is there a negative filter?  
16:21 <Guest10272> not at the moment I guess..  
16:21 <vmassol> not sure, don't think so, I'd need to look at the source but I'm in a conf call right now ;)  
16:21 <Guest10272> no problems..  
16:22 <Guest10272> I'll have a look there.. and see if I can modify it adding the negative filter..  
16:22 <vmassol> you could create a jira issue about it  
16:22 <Guest10272> ok thanks for your time ;)  
16:24 <Guest10272> has quit  
17:09 <kwoot> has quit  
17:36 <tmortagne> has quit

17:58 <vmassol> committers, I'd like a few more votes on " [VOTE] New xwiki-commons-environment module"  
17:58 <vmassol> I have it almost ready for committing  
18:18 <Orban> has joined #xwiki  
18:19 <lucaa> has quit  
18:23 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
18:23 <Orban> i'm having issues authenticating with even the default Admin/admin account... the logs arn't showing anything and i modified logback to log more details, but i'm not showing any errors or details on the failed authentication  
18:44 <lucaa> has quit  
18:53 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
19:02 <AndreiHalici> has quit  
19:40 <sburjan> has quit  
19:42 <mflorea> has quit  
20:00 <recompile> has quit  
20:00 <recompile> has joined #xwiki  
20:05 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
20:16 <tekzilla> trying LDAP auth, and the log says: DEBUG LDAP.XWikiLDAPAuthServiceImpl   - The provided user is null. We don't try to authenticate, it probably means the user is in non logged mode  
20:17 <tekzilla> does this mean xwiki doesnt even attempt to look anything up, because it's missing a username ?  
20:18 <tekzilla> this is on XWiki Enterprise 3.0.36132  
20:20 <tekzilla> will be afk 30min, going home  
20:39 <Denis> has quit  
20:39 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
22:02 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
22:41 <vmassol> has quit  
23:12 <abusenius> has quit  
23:12 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
23:33 <tekzilla> this happens on login when using LDAP auth: DEBUG LDAP.XWikiLDAPAuthServiceImpl   - The provided user is null. We don't try to authenticate, it probably means the user is in non logged mode  
23:34 <tekzilla> what does it mean  
23:48 <@sdumitriu> tekzilla: It means that there was no username provided in the request, as far as I can see from the code  
23:49 <@sdumitriu> Does it affect you in some way, or is it just something you'd like to understand?  
23:57 <abusenius> has quit  
23:59 <tekzilla> sdumitriu: thanks for your time
